business.headline: Nvidia to become world's most valued company ever with $3.9 trillion market capNvidia is set to become the most valuable company ever, reaching a $3.92 trillion market cap amid soaring AI demand. Its dominance in AI chipmaking has fuelled rapid growth, outpacing rivals like Apple and Microsoft.

IndiGo appoints former NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant as non-executive directorIndiGo has appointed former NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant as a Non-Executive Director on its board, pending regulatory and shareholder approvals.

RBI bars foreclosure charges on floating rate loans to micro, small businessesAccording to the new rules, no prepayment charges will be allowed on floating rate loans to MSEs or to individuals borrowing for business purposes.

How poor is 'poor' in India?Millions of Indians have exited extreme poverty, yet many still live one crisis away from hunger, debt, or despair. In this deep dive, we examine why poverty is retreating in numbers, but not in reality.

Meesho files confidential papers for IPO to raise Rs 4,250 crore: ReportMeesho is a well-known player in India's booming e-commerce space, taking on giants like Amazon and Flipkart, with big global investors such as Prosus, Elevation Capital, WestBridge Capital, SoftBank, and Peak XV Partners backing it.
Sensex settles 170 points lower, Nifty below 25,500; Maruti down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 170.22 points to end at 83,239.47, while the NSE Nifty50 fell by 48,10 points to close at 25,405.30.

Don't set and forget: Why your SIPs need regular check-upsWhile the idea of 'set it and forget it' may seem peaceful, doing so could lead to long-term underperformance, missed opportunities, or even a shortfall in your retirement goals.

Zerodha's Nithin Kamath cautions investors against risks in unlisted sharesNithin Kamath said that many people get carried away by the hype around buying shares of companies before they go public. But in reality, unlisted shares are risky and can leave investors stuck without a way to sell.

Has the oil market grown numb to conflict in the Middle East?Global oil demand growth in 2025 is on track to be just 870,000 barrels per day. This would make it the weakest year for oil demand since 2001, except during major economic disruptions like the 2008 financial crisis and the COVID-19 pandemic.

India's income inequality now worse than British era, says financial analystThe divide between India's rich and poor is bigger than ever, with almost half the people surviving on very little, while a privileged few hold most of the wealth, says Hardik Joshi, a financial analyst.

HDFC Bank CEO moves Supreme Court against Lilavati Hospital FIRThe clash between one of India's largest private banks and a big Mumbai hospital is linked to a financial transaction, but the exact details of the FIR or the amount involved were not shared in court.

Lost your ITR login? Here's how to file income tax using net bankingIf you can't remember your Income Tax portal password, you don't need to reset it straight away. Most major banks in India allow you to access the e-Filing portal through their net banking services. It's a safe and easy way to file your return on time.

entertainment.headline: Will never be forgotten: Shefali Jariwala's husband Parag Tyagi shares moving noteParag Tyagi shared a picture of Shefali Jariwala along with a heartfelt note on Instagram, remembering her selflessness and how she always put 'others first'. The 'Kaanta Laga' fame actor died on June 27 after suffering a cardiac arrrest.

Amitabh Bachchan reflects on 25 years of KBC, recalls first broadcastAmitabh Bachchan celebrated 25 years of Kaun Banega Crorepati, remembering the show's debut on July 3, 2000, while preparing for the new season. He shared an emotional post saying, "Didn't even realise, and 25 years just went by."

Aamir Khan rocks rugged look as Dahaa in Rajinikanth's Coolie, first look outAamir Khan's first look as Dahaa from Rajinikanth's upcoming film 'Coolie' was unveiled. The actor was seen in a rugged, pipe-smoking avatar.

Amar Upadhyay on Kyunki...craze: Mobbed at Taj Mahal, got marriage proposalsActor Amar Upadhyay recently got candid about his popularity after 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi.' He shared how his character became a household name after the show aired in 2000.

Nick Jonas helps Priyanka Chopra untie her hair, fans call him green forestActor Priyanka Chopra shared a video on Thursday in which her singer-husband Nick Jonas can be seen helping her untie her hair. Looking at the video, several fans called him a green flag.

Vijay Deverakonda's Kingdom release postponed again, new date to be announced soonA new release date for actor Vijay Deverakona's much-anticipated film 'Kingdom' will be announced soon. Film producer Naga Vamsi shared the latest update on his social media account.

Paranthu Po review: Charming family film teaches joy in life's simple thingsRelease Date:Fri Jul 04, 2025Paranthu Po movie review: Director Ram's 'Paranthu Po', starring Mirchi Shiva, Grace Antony and Mithul, is a profound story about self-discovery when you are busy running the city life. Without being too preachy, the film hits all the right notes.

Is The Traitors seducing new India through deception and manipulation?'The Traitors', which has already been renewed for the second season, celebrates lying and deception. Ahead of its finale tonight (July 3), here's decoding why the reality TV show is gaining popularity in India and its implications.

Bajrangi Bhaijaan's Harshali Malhotra to make South film debut with Akhanda 2Harshali Malhotra, known as Munni from 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan', is making her South debut with 'Akhanda 2' alongside Nandamuri Balakrishna. She introduced her new role, Janani, through an Instagram post, marking her return to films.

Ramayana 1st glimpse: Alia Bhatt, KJo and Sargun Mehta share their excitementSeveral celebrities, including Alia Bhatt, Karan Johar and Sargun Mehta reacted to the first glimpse of the much-anticipated film 'Ramayana'. The film is slated for a theatrical release on Diwali 2026.

Kyunki...turns 25: Smriti Irani, Amar Upadhayay, Ektaa Kapoor get nostalgic'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi' completed its 25-year run on July 3. On the special occasion, the cast, including Smriti Irani, Amar Upadhyay and Ektaa Kapoor shared their journey on the show.

Anushka Sharma, Virat Kohli enjoy strolling on London streets. Watch viral videoA video of Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli strolling on the London streets has emerged online. The two are currently holidaying in the UK.

Do actors pay for Hollywood Walk of Fame star? All about the processAfter the announcement of Deepika Padukone's latest Walk of Fame selection, many wonder about the process behind the recognition and whether celebs have to pay for it. Here's everything you need to know about it.

Exclusive: Fatima Sana Shaikh says she almost didn't audition for DangalFatima Sana Shaikh almost didn't audition for her breakthrough role in 'Dangal'. Her persistence and love for auditions continue to drive her career forward.

Why Ranbir Kapoor-Yash's Ramayana feels like a moment for Indian cinemaNitesh Tiwari's 'Ramayana' is a cinematic moment shaped by faith, scale, and storytelling ambition. With Ranbir Kapoor, Sai Pallavi, Yash, and Sunny Deol leading a power-packed cast, the film dares to honour the epic as more than mythology. The first glimpse feels less like a teaser and more like the beginning of something historic.

Kyunki… turns 25: When people fell at Ekta Kapoor's feet, cried over Mihir's death'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi', the iconic Indian television show that redefined the small screen 25 years ago, is all set for a grand comeback with a new season. On the note, its creative director, Nivedita Basu, spoke to us discussing its relevance, craze and BTS moments.

Anupam Kher recalls clash with Aamir Khan during Dil Hai Ke Manta Nahin shootAnupam Kher recalled a past disagreement with Aamir Khan during the shoot of 'Dil Hai Ke Manta Nahin', where Aamir criticised his scene interpretation. The actor shared the story while promoting his upcoming film 'Metro... In Dino', releasing on 4 July 2025.

Ramayana 1st look: Fans praise Ranbir Kapoor, background score gives goosebumpsNitesh Tiwari's 'Ramayana's first glimpse is finally out. The film starring Ranbir Kapoor has given goosebumps to fans, with many praising the background score.

Parag Tyagi consoles Shefali Jariwala's father as he breaks down at prayer meetAn emotional video of late actor Shefali Jariwala's husband, Parag Tyagi, consoling her father has surfaced on social media. The video is from her prayer meeting held in Mumbai on Wednesday.

general news.headline: Had only 30 seconds to react: Pak PM's aide on India's BrahMos attackRana Sanaullah, special assistant to Pakistan's Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif, said in a recent interview that the launch of a BrahMos cruise missile during India's "Operation Sindoor" left Pakistan's defence apparatus scrambling.

Delhi's end-of-life vehicles won't be impounded, government to tweak policyThe Delhi government has also written to the Commission for Air Quality Management to hold onto the decision which mandates the denial of fuel to End-of-Life (EOL) vehicles in Delhi.

If Marathi is insulted, things escalate: Aaditya Thackeray on shopkeeper's assaultAaditya Thackeray's remarks come a day after a video went viral showing Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) workers assaulting a shopkeeper for not knowing Marathi.

Majestic Shubman Gill, pacers hand Bazball its sternest test on Day 2England vs India, 2nd Test: India's pacers Akash Deep and Mohammed Siraj reduced England to 77 for 3 after the visitors posted a commanding 587 in their first innings, thanks to skipper Shubman Gill's record-breaking 269 on day two of the second Test at Edgbaston.

Indian-origin man chokes co-passenger mid-flight, arrested upon landing in USThe 21-year-old Indian-origin man was involved in a mid-air brawl with another passenger. He was arrested upon landing at Miami airport.

D Gukesh defeats Magnus Carlsen days after explosive comment from World No. 1Indian chess prodigy D Gukesh delivered another stunning performance on Thursday, defeating World No.1 Magnus Carlsen with the Black pieces in the sixth round of the Grand Chess Tour's SuperUnited Rapid in Zagreb—just days after the Norwegian labelled him "one of the presumably weaker players".

Tatkal in 60 seconds: Telegram racket sell Aadhaar IDs after railway announcementUnauthorised ticketing platforms claim to book Tatkal tickets in 60 seconds using bots and Aadhaar-verified IRCTC accounts, risking user data.

Wimbledon Day 4 Live: Swiatek into Round 3, Sinner wins 1st set vs VukicWimbledon 2025, Day 4 live score and updates: Emma Navarro is through to the third round of singles after beating Veronika Kudermetova. Novak Djokovic and Iga Swiatek advanced to the third round. Jannik Sinner is facing Aleksander Vukic in the last match of the day on Centre Court.

Is India's Pakistan policy inconsistent? Democratic Newsroom debatesThe latest episode of Democratic Newsroom delves into India's Pakistan policy after the Pahalgam terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir.

BJP leader Jagannath Pradhan arrested in connection with assault on Odisha bureaucratBJP leader Jagannath Pradhan has been arrested in connection with the Odisha bureaucrat assault case. Earlier, a video of the assault had gone viral online which showed Sahoo being manhandled by a group of men.

Hindu students made to recite Islamic verse in Kota school, video viralThe incident, which occurred at a school in Rajasthan's Kota, has sparked outrage among Hindu outfits, who have warned of massive protests if action was not taken against the management.

Aamir Khan rocks rugged look as Dahaa in Rajinikanth's Coolie, first look outAamir Khan's first look as Dahaa from Rajinikanth's upcoming film 'Coolie' was unveiled. The actor was seen in a rugged, pipe-smoking avatar.

Will never be forgotten: Shefali Jariwala's husband Parag Tyagi shares moving noteParag Tyagi shared a picture of Shefali Jariwala along with a heartfelt note on Instagram, remembering her selflessness and how she always put 'others first'. Video: Students cross river on rubber boat risking their lives in PalgharAmid heavy rain, students were seen crossing a river on a rubber boat, risking their lives in Maharashtra's Palghar district.

The thick red line: Why India shouldn't agree with US on agriThe India-US trade deal is reportedly stuck because of DC's tough demands on the agriculture and dairy sectors. India shouldn't give in to Donald Trump's demands because agriculture is hugely subsidised in the US, with farmers there getting over $61,000 against India's $282. If concessions are to be made, it should be by the US, and not India. Here's why.

Blinded by love for uncle, newly married woman gets her husband killed, 3 arrestedBlinded by love for her uncle, a woman in Aurangabad plotted her husband's murder just 45 days after their marriage. Police arrested three, including wife Goonja Singh, who confessed to the conspiracy.

How poor is 'poor' in India?Millions of Indians have exited extreme poverty, yet many still live one crisis away from hunger, debt, or despair. In this deep dive, we examine why poverty is retreating in numbers, but not in reality.

Brazil eyes India's Akash system that killed Pak missiles during Op SindoorBrics member Brazil has shown keen interest in India's Akash supersonic missiles, among other India-made military hardware. Brazil's interest in Akash comes after its stellar performance against Pakistani attacks during Operation Sindoor. PM Modi will be visiting Brazil this week and talks are likely to include defence cooperation.

Khloe Kardashian thanks India-born surgeon for nose jobAmerican celebrity and influencer Khloe Kardashian recently confirmed that she had undergone several cosmetic procedures, including a nose job. Now, Khloe thanked an India-born doctor, Raj Kanodia, whom she credited for her rhinoplasty. Kanodia, one of LA's top rhinoplasty specialists, was born in Kolkata and has worked with celebrities, including Britney Spears and Kim Kardashian.

How dowry continues to ensnare women in Tamil Nadu, and around IndiaThe social menace thrives in a new form—as lavish weddings and heavy gold jewellery 'for the bride', the generosity fuelling further entitlement and often fatal violence

PM says India has over 2,500 political parties, sets off buzz in Ghana ParliamentAddressing the Ghanian Parliament in English, PM Modi described India as mother of democracy and pointed out that the nation has over 2,500 political parties.

Dilip Tirkey on Pakistan getting nod for tournaments in India: Good for hockeyHockey India president Dilip Tirkey has welcomed the call to allow the Pakistan teams to participate in the multi-nation tournaments in India. The call was reportedly made on Thursday, July 3 to allow Pakistan to participate in Asia Cup and Junior World Cup in India this year.

Pakistan awaits government nod for Asia Cup and Junior World Cup hockey in IndiaSenior officials from the Pakistan Sports Board (PSB) and the Pakistan Hockey Federation (PHF) have stated that they are still awaiting government clearance to participate in two major hockey events scheduled to take place in India later this year.

Novak Djokovic reaches special 99, Andreeva, de Minaur advanceWimbledon 2025: Novak Djokovic racked up his 99th win at SW19 after beating Dan Evans in straight sets on Centre Court. Mirra Andreeva, Alex de Minaur and Elena Rybakina also qualified for the third round.

Neeraj Chopra plans addition of more athletic events to NC Classic in futureOlympic champion Neeraj Chopra on Thursday confirmed that the Neeraj Chopra Classic could feature additional events in the coming years. Murray's autographed shirt from 2013 Wimbledon final up for auctionAndy Murray's autographed shirt from the Wimbledon 2013 final went up for auction. Murray won the grass court major after beating Novak Djokovic in straight sets in the final.

Diogo Jota death: Former Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp sends emotional messageFormer Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp sent an emotional message to remember Diogo Jota, who passed away after a car crash in Spain on Thursday, July 3.

Explained: Have Edgbaston boundaries been shortened to aid England's BazballThe boundary dimensions at Edgbaston sparked widespread curiosity as play got underway in the second Test between England and India. Former England pacer Steven Finn suggested that the shortened boundaries were in line with England's Bazball approach under Ben Stokes and Brendon McCullum.

Brook and Root have rescued England after the initial collapse but the day belonged to the visitors.

Liverpool footballer Diogo Jota dies in car accident, 10 days after weddingLiverpool and Portugal forward Diogo Jota has reportedly died in a car accident in Spain, just days after his wedding. His brother André, also a footballer, was travelling with him and also died in the crash.

Tennis is difficult: Emma Raducanu after Zverev sparks mental health chatEmma Raducanu opened up about the emotional toll of professional tennis amid Alexander Zverev's candid revelation, stressing the importance of mental resilience and support systems in a sport where defeat is more common than victory.

Watch: Ishan Kishan imitates Harbhajan Singh in rare County bowling chanceIshan Kishan has been enjoying his time in the UK. After hitting back-to-back fifties for Nottinghamshire in County Championships, Ishan entertained when he was given an opportunity to bowl on Wednesday, July 02.

ENG vs IND: Shubman Gill slots into No. 4 like he has always belongedOn a day that was dominated by Jasprit Bumrah being rested for the Edgbaston Test, Shubman Gill showed why he was the best man to take up the mantle and continue India's rich tradition of having the best players at No.4 in Tests.

Shubman Gill has been an amazing captain, says Yashasvi JaiswalENG vs IND, 2nd Test: Yashasvi Jaiswal praised captain Shubman Gill, who scored a dogged hundred off 199 balls. It was his back-to-back centuries for the Indian skipper, having scored one on his Test captaincy debut in Leeds.

Tough talk, tame tactics: Gambhir faces heat over Edgbaston Test selection callsEngland vs India, 2nd Test: India head coach Gautam Gambhir's bold words after the Headingley Test defeat rang hollow at Edgbaston, where India's defensive team selection for the Edgbaston Test exposed a growing gap between his statements and actions.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
